doc:
Hoyt Axton https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyt_Axton 0 Hoyt Wayne Axton (March 25, 1938 – October 26, 1999) was an American folk music singer-songwriter, guitarist, and a film and television actor. He became prominent in the early-1960s, establishing himself on the West Coast as a folk singer with an earthy style and powerful voice. As he matured, some of his songwriting became well known throughout the world. Among them were "Joy to the World", "The Pusher", "No No Song", "Greenback Dollar", "Della and the Dealer", and "Never Been to Spain". Hoyt_Wayne_Axton ( March_25_,_1938 – October_26_,_1999 ) was an_American_folk_music_singer-songwriter , guitarist , and a_film_and_television_actor . He became prominent in the_early-1960s , establishing himself on the_West_Coast as a_folk_singer with an_earthy_style_and_powerful_voice . As he matured , some of his_songwriting became well_known throughout the_world . Among them were " Joy to the_World " , " The_Pusher_" , " No_No_Song " , " Greenback_Dollar " , " Della and the_Dealer_" , and " Never_Been to Spain " .
